attributes.action: Council tax banding needs updating
attributes.background: Council tax banding needs to reflect the current market. Many houses are worth more than a million and yet the banding has not been updated.
attributes.additional_details: With councils in debts as it is, higher valued properties I.e. 1 million, 2 million etc need additional banding beyond H. Please add more bands to pay for social care etc.

attributes.action: Increase the funding into grassroots football in the UK.
attributes.background: I believe the state of amateur football picthes across the UK is appalling. The amount of injuries sustained to young and old footballers is increasing on these sort of playing fields. In my opinion, by improving pitches it will not only benefit football in general but the entire nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: I have sustained injuries on the current playing fields near my house playing for my local side. Furthermore, I know many others who have had similar experiences to myself. I believe that if we had better grass to play on, it would motivate more of the public to get involved in the sport as well as just getting healthier as a nation. By improving grassroots football, we are becoming healthier and more motivated. Football is just the beginning ,we could also improve rugby pitches and many more.

attributes.action: Make 1hr meal breaks compulsory for motorcycle, bicycle, & van couriers.
attributes.background: Motorcycle, van, & bicycle couriers are all often working very long hours with no daily lunch breaks at a set time. Although the work is not technically challenging, it still requires high levels of concentration & physical effort. 1hr lunch breaks will restore concentration & prevent accidents.
attributes.additional_details: Courier &/or food delivery firms are growing in numbers year on year in a big way. There is an ever growing demand for riders &/or drivers. Riders &/or drivers can be paid employees or self employed subcontractors. Many, if not all riders &/or drivers are not currently allowed to have a daily lunch break. Both types of drivers &/or riders deserve the same right to have 1hrs lunch break for their own safety & for the restoration of concentration for the prevention of accidents.

attributes.action: Take English literature off the National curriculum
attributes.background: English literature is not as important as English Language, schools should spend their time teaching students to improve their speaking, grammar and how to articulate themselves.We recently had GCSE mock exams and students who were taught only Language excelled in their results ,where as students
attributes.additional_details: who were being taught Literature and Language failed in both, as more time was spent studying literature.Employers look at English language GCSE qualifications as more important than English literature.Literature should be optional and not compulsory as some students would like to go into the Literature field and it shouldn't be completely discredited, however it should not be as significant to gain a GCSE in English Literature as it is in English Language.

attributes.action: The UK Prime Minister and Parliament must publicly condemn Trump's BBC ban
attributes.background: On 24th February, UK public service broadcaster BBC and several other media outlets were barred from attending an audience with US White House Press Speaker. This happened only hours after President Donald Trump had tweeted that "fake news media" were "the enemy of the American people".
attributes.additional_details: This unprecedented decision is not only an affront to freedom of expression in general, but also an insult to the professional integrity and ethics of the UK public service broadcasting system. The UK PM has invited Trump to pay a state visit in our country, which will be also covered in the news by the very same public organisation that he has now publicly distrusted. The UK PM and Parliament must unequivocally condemn President Trump's BBC ban as well as all his attacks to the media.

attributes.action: Require all animal breeding for commercial (sale) purposes to be licensed
attributes.background:
Only the breeding of dogs is currently licensed, while current sale legislation (Pet Animals Act 1951), is outdated and does little to protect animals.

We put it to Parliament that the licensing standard for dog breeding should extend to all animals which are bred for commercial (sale) purposes.
attributes.additional_details:
A bill on the breeding and sale of cats had its first reading in the House of Lords in 2015, but has not progressed any further. 

The explanatory notes from said reading provide a background and review some of the issues that result from a lack of regulation in the breeding and sale of animals: https://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2015-2016/0033/en/16033en01.htm

attributes.action: NHS to be run by each local council rather than a national organisation
attributes.background: The NHS is run as a national organisation which means that money is wasted rather than being spent on the actual needs of hospitals. This would look to change that and instead give the responsibilities of running the local NHS to local councils - looking at the hospital needs, therefore less waste.

attributes.action: Educate KS4 students with functional skills they can use later in life.
attributes.background: In schools students are taught a variety of different things, but something the education system doesn't teach is functional skills. Being 16 I have no idea how to pay tax or take out a mortgage on a house but we get taught how to analyse 18th century literature..
attributes.additional_details: I would like MORE time dedicated in our schooling (once in KS4) to things we can use later in everyday life in exchange for things that only a small percentage of us will use later in life.

attributes.action: To stop the government removing the subsidy for blood test strips.
attributes.background: I would like to ask the government not to remove the subsidy for blood test strips. Diabetics need very frequent blood testing 5+ times a day. The cost of strips is £70.00 the outcome of stopping this is reduced blood glucose testing and more hospital admissions from hyper or hypo glycemic Diabetes.

attributes.action: Enable Young Couples to Rent by Regulating HMO Licenses
attributes.background:
Young professionals are being forced out of Cities such as Oxford and Cambridge to move back in with their parents due to lack of housing caused by HMO regulations.
We need to have the regulations changed so councils cannot go as low as 2 households / 3 people to require an HMO license.
attributes.additional_details:
Many councils have implemented regulations that prevent more than THREE people residing in a dwelling. Even if TWO of those are a renting couple.

While HMOs may have increased the number of rooms to rent, it is equally removing the amount of available properties for young professionals. Our government should be aware and improve these HMO regulations to ensure more availability.
I strongly believe this will help stabilise housing and help hundreds of individuals who are a value to our cities.

attributes.action: Change the law on pricing of haircuts/colour. Shouldn't matter what sex you are.
attributes.background: Females have been fighting for equal opportunity for decades. I called a hairdresser today to book an appointment for my partner. I asked for a price and got asked if my partner was male or female, I asked why that was important and I was told because for a female it is more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Females have been fighting for equal opportunities for centuries. Charging females more for a haircut is no different to females getting paid less for doing the same job as a male. There should be gender neutral pricing laws. The pricing for haircuts/colour should be based on the length of the hair, not the sex of the person having their hair done. I called Kula Kuts in Kent and Toni & guy and both these salons informed me that a female having the same haircut or colour as a male would pay more.

attributes.action: Tattoos legal for 16 years olds with parental consent
attributes.background: I believe that as long as there is a parent present or on the phone when the child wants the tattoo then that is acceptable because I'm sure a parent wouldn't let their 16 year old get something tattooed that they will obviously regret in the future and the parent will want to know what it is before
attributes.additional_details: I'm 16 years old and personally I want a tattoo my mum found no reason as to why I shouldn't have one as it's not something inappropriate that I will want to have removed or covered up and i believe that a parents opinion matters as if I was to get a tattoo without my parents consent I'm more likely to get an unsuitable, unacceptable or regrettable tattoo I understand some parents don't want their child being tattooed thats why I think it is fair to have parental consent beforehand

attributes.action: Stop the Port of Dover using the A20 coast bound lane as a lorry park
attributes.background: For over ten years the port of dover has been stacking lorries on the A20 heading to the port. causing problems to local residents the works are now finished in the port and the main road to it now is the time to stop the practice of stacking lorries in front of our homes.
attributes.additional_details: A new road improvement costing millions has just been completed  with two lanes now in use. Port of Dover Police are stopping lorries on the outskirts of dover for the reason of not blocking the port which also has had a major road improvement with ten lanes to hold the lorries

attributes.action: op out of paying into the overseas aid budget and put this to tax to  the NHS
attributes.background: I don't want to put my tax to country's that can afford to send rockets into space when in the uk we have  old people on trolleys in hospital's we need to put the overseas budget to the NHS . if you want to pay into the overseas aid you can op in through the tax system
attributes.additional_details: read the press

attributes.action: To debate the political impartiality of the Speaker of the House of Commons.
attributes.background: The Speaker of the House of Commons is meant to be impartial. Our Parliament successfully functions because of a set of values, rules and processes. Infringing these rules undermines Parliamentary Democracy and the Institution of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should consider the Speakers' recently expressed opinion on foreign policy matters, particularly his hostile position to a US Presidential address and his welcoming stance in relation to countries with a history of human rights abuse including China, Singapore, Indonesia and Kuwait. His inconsistent tolerance of applause in the Commons (acceptable at the end of his own speech and not at the end of SNP speeches) should also be considered.

attributes.action: UK Armed Police to be paid slightly more than normal police officers. Danger Pay
attributes.background:
UK Armed Police are ranked and paid like normal police officers however, im sure we can all agree the two jobs are very different.

Granted they volunteer for the role however, carrying firearms and being responsible for being the first in to terrorist threats to protect the public is different.
attributes.additional_details:
They should be paid slightly more.

Im not saying pop star wage, or even a considerable amount. Im talking a couple hundred pounds extra a month as lets say, danger pay and risk over reward pay. Give them that extra satisfaction that its worth the risk. Not everyone could do their job, it requires a different human being, so pay them that difference.

attributes.action: request that the government consider 'rewilding' Britain to help save ecosystems
attributes.background: many animals that are now extinct or endangered in this country have been proven to greatly improve the countryside of other countries, such as beavers being effective flood defenders. to restore the natural balance in our ecosystems, the government should consider proposals from Rewilding Britain.
attributes.additional_details: some of the animals considered to be reintroduced are: lynx, beaver, boar, pine martens, many species of birds such as hawks, eagles and owls, marine life including whales and even wolves and bears, although the proposed introduction of these would require consultation with local residents due to ill-deserved stigma and perceived danger (top predators like these usually leave humans alone). when introduced, these animals should be under protection by law from hunting and destruction of habitats.

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of Alcohol on UK TV.
attributes.background:
The UK Government are living in the dark ages, they have put a clear ban on all Tobacco products, banning smoking in public places and at work, Banning all TV adverts for Tobacco products.

Alcohol should be banned, there are more kids Drinking in 2017 than there are Smoking.

Alcohol is worse.
attributes.additional_details:
Go to you local street corner and look at the kids and what they are doing PM's.

Most of them are getting pissed only 2 out of 5 will be smoking.

Get a grip on real life and wake up.

attributes.action: Revoke requiring military personnel to swear Oath to the Monarchy & God.
attributes.background:
I considered joining the Navy Reserves until I discovered you are required to swear and Oath of Alliegence to the Monarch and God. 
I feel this shouldn't be in place as it can prevent people from wanting to join. An oath to the Monarchy and religious beliefs should not interfere with service.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oath_of_Allegiance_(United_Kingdom)#Armed_forces

attributes.action: Make it a criminal act to present wrong information to influence a public vote.
attributes.background: With the recent public vote in the UK it is clear that the argument was heavily influenced by individuals knowingly communicating wrong information.  The act of knowingly presenting unverified facts for influence should be  punished.  The message is that our democracy will not accept such behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: There has in the past year been an upsurge in politicians and individuals presenting fake facts to influence votes of national importance.  These "fake facts" and "fake news" have been seen as an acceptable tactic by the perpetrators. Our country needs to get this under control and send a signal because its continuation will undermine the democratic process.  Without sanctions these types of lies will undermine our society. The action needs to cover both traditional and social media.

attributes.action: Get Patients The Right to Appeal Removal From G.P Surgery
attributes.background:
As it stands G.Ps can have a patient removed from their list simply by requesting this.
They can cite various reasons, aggressive behaviour , breakdown of Doctor Patient relationship.

The Patient has absolutely no right to appeal or even refute allegations made against them.
attributes.additional_details:
If any individual is accused of anything they should have the right to defend themselves.

In less than one year I have been removed twice & both times the reasons given were downright blatant lies.

attributes.action: Capital gains tax should be levied on the sale of second homes.
attributes.background: The housing crisis is being exacerbated by the out of control practice of residential property being traded as a capital gains tax free investment. Every aspect of UK society would benefit by a capital gains tax being levied on the sale of all second homes.

attributes.action: UK must copy Donald Trump's travel ban on 7 countries and also ban Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: We the undersigned want UK to adopt the travel ban and also ban Saudi Arabia. Not taking refugees and closing our borders doesn't mean we are “heartless” or “racists”. I lock my doors every night. I don't lock them because I "hate" the people outside. I lock them because I LOVE the people INSIDE!
attributes.additional_details: There’s no way to effectively screen people to identify if they intend to do a terror attack. We don't hate immigrants but those countries have too much terror risks and we can't allow them in. Also Saudi Arabia is even worse. The financial benefits from visiting wealthy Saudis are only benefiting the super rich.

attributes.action: Legal Immigrants on different visas category  must get ILR
attributes.background: Those immigrants who lived in Great Britain legally for 10 years should get indefinite leave to remain without any question as long as they do not have criminal convictions
attributes.additional_details:
Tier 1 visa category
Tier 2 visa category

attributes.action: Increase UK Summer School Holidays By at Least 1-2 weeks
attributes.background: We don't get long enough holidays but schools and local authorities feel they have the need to fine us just because we leave school at least a week early. I understand education Is vital, but at least let us leave school for the summer as soon as we have finished our final exams.
attributes.additional_details: With all respect i believe it is very unfair, in the summer i would like to be seeing my family abroad not doing exams 3 weeks early then just doing nothing at school. Most Countries Including America get like 3 month holidays i am not asking for that. I am just asking for you to consider my request that we can leave school for the holidays as soon as we finish our exams. However, I understand that in some occasions it may not be possible, but i am asking you to please consider this.

attributes.action: Make armed forces pay similar or inline with those in public services.
attributes.background: The fact that the armed forces personnel are away from families and loves ones and are only on or around £19000 p/a. This is with no overtime rates and to work unsociable hours and long periods of time away. Commitment bonuses are lessoning and and advance trade pay is non existent to better the job

attributes.action: Chemists should provide receipts of prices for all items prescribed by doctors.
attributes.background: and also give information on whether the items can be purchased over the counter. this could save both the customer and the NHS a significant   amount of money and would also show how fortunate we are to have our NHS and only be paying £8.40 per item for such high priced medication.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if people knew how much they cost the NHS each month with un needed repeat prescriptions and half finished courses of medicines, as well as knowing if the drugs available to buy cheaper  over the counter it would greatly change the attitude a lot of people have with regards to our NHS and how they can make a great financial  difference to it, freeing up  money to hire more staff, pay the staff they have a decent wage  and fund further research efforts.

attributes.action: Stop intelligence sharing with the USA and recall the UK Ambassador to the USA.
attributes.background: Suspend intelligence sharing with the USA to ensure that President Trump's new policy of religious discrimination is in no way assisted by the UK.The UK should also condem these actions by recalling the ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
If we should learn anything from the Holocaust it is that descrimination based on religious beliefs is wrong and dangerous. 

"First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Socialist. 
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me- and there was no one left to speak for me." Martin Niemöller

attributes.action: Remove the ban on owning Dogo argentinos,
attributes.background: Since 1991 this breed has been banned in the UK under the dangerous dogs act 1991, I propose that this law to either be heavily changed or removed, as people are becoming more aware that with this specific species the dogs themselves are not the problem, but the people that misuse and abuse them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogo argentinos are used as family dogs and guard dogs In their native country, just like GSD's, dobermann's and Rottweilers, they are renowned for their loyalty, and maternal instincts, to ban on dog because it looks menacing is wrong, as it promotes people to keep them for all the wrong reasons, just like every other dog consistent training and socialisation makes them perfect pets and companions, they are smart and are a reward to own because of their close loving bond with their owners.

attributes.action: I want the Jobcentre on Eastern Avenue in Sheffield to be saved
attributes.background:
The S2 area of Sheffield is full of vulnerable people, the support that is provided from the staff in this building is very positive.
Ive attended other jobcentres in the past but they have no connection with the area or the people in it. Eastern Avenue helps you feel like your not just a statistic
attributes.additional_details: Also why is it that in Sheffield only people from our area are going to be affected? People on benefits are in financial difficulty already and can easily walk to their local jobcentre to attend appointments and now only we are going to have to travel by public transport at additional costs to ourselves. I believed that we all had equal rights in this country and all should be treated the same so why only close the one office. Once again the government in this country treat us like a statistic.

attributes.action: Contraceptive pill boxes to warn of major factors making the pill less effective
attributes.background: We would like legislation requiring manufacturers of contraceptive pills to clearly and prominently display a warning on the packaging showing the major factors in the pill being less effective. We would like a warning similar to that of a cigarette packet
attributes.additional_details: The side effects and health risk associated with all medication are contained on a large leaflet within the box. We would like to see the main factors causing the contraceptive pill to be less effective or ineffective printed in bold letters on the outside of the box. Many become pregnant each year believing that this will not happen as they have chosen to use the pill only to find that something else such as a bout of illness has stopped the pill working.

attributes.action: Reconstruct The Crystal Palace
attributes.background: The Crystal Palace was an impressive architectural feat with a design that was arguably ahead of its time.  This impressive piece of Victorian heritage was cruelly destroyed by fire in 1936, depriving too many from ever having seen it in all it's glory.  Please re-build this long lost treasure.
attributes.additional_details:
The Crystal Palace was first constructed in 1851 in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition, which showcased new technology from the Industrial Revolution. It was moved to the Sydenham/Penge area in 1854 and opened by Queen Victoria.  

As an attraction the Crystal Palace showcased a wide variety of festivals and events.  Reconstructing the Palace would be a fantastic opportunity to reinvigorate the area as a cultural hub and return a part of our history that should never have been lost.

attributes.action: Seek Closer Relations With Russia
attributes.background: Russia is a powerful nation, one that is under siege. We've all heard the countless things that Russia has done to show off it's armed forces, but can we blame them? The media heavily shows Russia as the bad guys but that's simply not true. The west are the ones at fault.
attributes.additional_details: Time and time again we provoke Russia and when we get a response our media instantly turns on it's propaganda machines and makes us look innocent. What good would it be to continue trade sanctions and threatening them with military action (Not directly - but through military drills). If we wish to have 'everlasting peace in our time' - then the solution is not to provoke a country into a state where it wishes to defend itself. Instead of such provocations we should seek diplomacy of co-operation

attributes.action: Make voting in general elections, and in future referendums compulsory.
attributes.background: Given the historical sacrifices made over any number of years by countless groups and individuals to enfranchise the public, the public should be required to vote, even if the choice is "none of the above". The lack of voting is a distinct failing or our democracy.

attributes.action: Call a general election in two years when the terms for Brexit are known.
attributes.background:
Whilst Parliament will be given an opportunity to comment on terms of Brexit, the UK public will not be able to vote on the biggest political decision in decades.

There is no democracy in this as the terms of Brexit were not clear when the referendum vote took place.

attributes.action: Allow people to make voluntary contributions to the NHS
attributes.background:
By signing this petition you are asking MPs to debate the feasibility of allowing the public to make voluntary financial contributions to the NHS.
Voluntary contributions could help ease the strain on the health service and the people who work in it at a time when they face unprecedented pressure.
attributes.additional_details:
Allowing members of the public to make voluntary contributions to the NHS would provide people with the means to aid and potentially save an institution that has at some point in their lives helped them. 
By signing this petition you send a message of solidarity to the workers of the NHS, that you acknowledge that the difficulties the health service currently faces are not the result of their work ethos or competence but of the funding constraints that are placed upon them.

attributes.action: To stop the £1,000 immigration skills charge for workers outside the EU
attributes.background:
The Immigration Minister Robert Goodwill has suggested.
A £1,000 immigration "skills charge" is being brought in this April for firms recruiting workers from outside the EU. This means that when we leave the EU, the 3 million EU citizens, who live in this country may have to pay this too.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-38581873

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK and stop NHS prescription charges.
attributes.background: It is fundamentally unfair that citizens in England have to pay NHS prescription charges (currently £8.40) whilst in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland they are free. These charges raise less than 0.5% of the NHS budget so are negligible, we in England should receive parity with the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Ban smacking children in the UK
attributes.background: Britain is now one of just four countries in Europe where smacking remains a legal way of disciplining children. Many studies have demonstrated that smacking has no long-term positive impact on children.  Please sign this petition to defend the basic human rights of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many other, more effective, ways to discipline children that do not involve inflicting physical harm on them. 

Smacking should not be regarded as merely a form of discipline; it is assault and it must not be tolerated in this day and age. It is unacceptable that assaulted adults can go to the police, but assaulted children have no form of recourse.

attributes.action: Make tips tax free for waiters and waitresses.
attributes.background: Currently waiters and waitresses have to declare their tips to HMRC. These tips do not form part of the bill and are a thank you gift to the waiter or waitress for providing a great service and working unsociable hours. HMRC will still generate tax revenues from the bill.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing the waiter or waitress to take the money home that night will avoid unscrupulous employers charging them admin fees on tips or taking a share for breakages and spillages.

attributes.action: Delay plans for harsh voter ID trials until it passes a public consultation
attributes.background: In wake of the recent tower hamlets scandal, the government is trialling plans for photo voter ID laws, which would undermine democracy and disenfranchise millions of voters
attributes.additional_details: This sets a very dangerous precedent, with the possibility that many people who do not own or are unable to get a passport or driving license are not able to exercise their democratic rights, voter registration laws have already been tightened and this signals a worrying first step toward an american style system wherein voter ID laws are passed simply to prevent certain demographics from voting, these plans need at least a public consultation or some sort of free photo ID to be provided

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Reduce income tax paid on bonus payments
attributes.background:
We work hard to achieve a bonus at work, however the tax that we are paying on bonuses is nearly a third including NI contributions.

Bonuses are achieved by companies and/or individuals doing well in their career and they deserve to earn their full reward for this.

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: Ban Triclosan from UK products
attributes.background: The USA Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has banned hand soaps containing triclosan, after ruling that the antibacterial chemical could contribute to antibiotic resistance. Triclosan and other potentially harmful antibacterial chemicals are widely used  in hand washes, deodorants and toothpastes

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: treat addiction as a mental health problem rather than criminal justice problem
attributes.background: The war on drugs has been a war fought with misinformation. We should not punish addicts but treat their addiction and what they choose to escape from when under the influence of substance abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Chasing the scream by Johann Hari

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.
